channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: A lithography-free approach to polaritonic Luneburg lenses
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 20 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63097-8

This study presents a lithography-free and cost-effective strategy for fabricating planar polaritonic Luneburg lenses, based on the controlled melting of polymer microspheres on the surface of van der Waals polaritonic materials.

item.title: Disordered-guiding photonic chip enabled high-dimensional light field detection
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 20 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63130-w

The authors present an on-chip intelligent high-dimensional light field detection system for single-shot accurate measurement of intensity, polarization, and spectrum — achieving superior resolution and integration compared to conventional system
